text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The government shows decisiveness towards the arrogance of unions in Cyprus Airways.
- Bank of Cyprus chairman Solon Triantafyllides is optimistic on its future.

- The government issues warnings to Cyprus Airways. Finance Minister Christodoulos Christodoulou warns the government may deny a new multi-million pound loan guarantee if unions do not show some responsibility.
- A study confirms that there is a massive cholesterol and weight problem among Cypriot children.
- The Central Committee of Communist party Akel agrees the party should continue consultations with opposition forces on the possiblility of cooperating in the presidential poll in early 1998.

- Akel is to continue its consultations with opposition parties until the end of May to find a presidential candidate. In a surprise move the leaders of Socialist Edek and the centre-right Democratic Party announce the start of a dialogue between them on possible cooperation in the elections.
- Akel has shown preference to former foreign minister George Iakovou to be its candidate in the presidential elections.
